qas.question: Where has there been a rise in evangelical Protestantism?

answers.text: In the United States and elsewhere in the world

qas.question: What type of churches have declined?

answers.text: In the post–World War I era

qas.question: When did conservative churches start to increase?

answers.text: In the post–World War II era

qas.question: What type of evangelical churches are the most popular?

answers.text: those that are more exclusively evangelical

context: <a0_0>In the United States and elsewhere in the world<a0_0/>, there has been a marked rise in the evangelical wing of Protestant denominations, especially <a4_0>those that are more exclusively evangelical<a4_0/>, and a corresponding decline in the <a1_0>mainstream liberal churches<a1_0/>. <a2_0>In the post–World War I era<a2_0/>, Liberal Christianity was on the rise, and a considerable number of seminaries held and taught from a liberal perspective as well. <a3_0>In the post–World War II era<a3_0/>, the trend began to swing back towards the conservative camp in America's seminaries and church structures.
